description:
I'm a daily customer of Whole Cakes. Their morning muffins are always spot on! Their coffee is fresh and smooth. Customer service is with a smile as they continuously make their culinary delights. This place is a gem!!!

Today I tried the new Whole Cakes Creamy Nut Butter, made with *peanuts, *walunuts, *honey, sea salt, and *maple syrup (* = organic). This is a perfect nut butter blend. The combination of the rich nuts with the subtle flavor of salt and natures sweeter (maple syrup) is a great way to satisfy your hunger. Consider putting Whole Cake's Nut Butter on toast, a Nut Butter and Jelly sandwich, or just out of the jar, you'll be smiling the whole time!
author: Scott P.

description:
Friendly people & great cakes!

Located in a small shop of mission street near 1st, WholeCakes is local & organic. Sonya was very pleasant and if you have any question, she's the one to answer your inquiries. For cake orders, they recommend 48 hrs in advance but took care of mine in less than 24hrs! =)
If you come in the morning, you'll also get to see fresh pastry or muffin by the window cooling off! They also  have cookies and coffee (get their stamp card for buy 10=1 free drink).
I ordered the Chiffon Matcha with fresh mango 8inch cake, while expensive at $55.00, you pay for the quality and great taste. You can request writing such as happy birthday on it, which is different than your normal cake shop because the writing is on a very thin chocolate and looks very appealing. The cake is light and fluffy, cream is on point and everything about this cake was worth every bite & dollar! If you're nearby, they can also deliver to your business or office for a small fee. I'll definitely swing by to greet Sonya & try something new next time!
author: Hao B.

description:
My friends and I went on 8/24/2018.

Food: 
-1 star
I only got to try a slice of chocolate-based cake and 2 cookies, as everything else was not for sale (whole cakes made to order), or sold out for the day, but I have a feeling their other cakes could be 5 stars.  The slice of chocolate-based cake I bought seemed similar both in texture and in taste, as Betty Crocker's chocolate cake mix.  The 2 small cookies were good, but for $2 each, I would have expected again, something more than what seemed to have come from a good cookie mix.

Service:
-2 stars
Unfortunately, the customer service was what really shocked me about this place.  I get it, we're in San Francisco, your cakes on display are almost always only made to order, so you think it's annoying and worth ridiculing that I even asked if they were available for sale in slices or whole.  The unpleasantness was the attitude of the staff when I asked what was available.  They let me ask 1 by 1 if each item was available instead of simplying saying they were out of stock in everything, except for 3 slices of chocolate cake.  After they said nothing else was available, I asked about 2 trays of what looked like crispy bars (?) and the male staff member looked over (noticed that they were indeed, not sold out of that) but simply replied "mmm . . . but then we'd have to cut them.  No. Those aren't for sale."  So you'd rather let a customer walk out today so you don't have to cut them, and sell them unfresh the next day?  I proceeded to get the slice of chocolate cake and 2 cookie flavors they had available.  

For those of you who are familiar with this joint, there is an area with 3-4 bar seats and a bar counter in the shop.  The staff were unpacking boxes while I was in there, which obstructed all the chairs and counter space.  Being busy is understandable, but no one bothered apologizing or addressing for the fact that there was no counterspace available to actually eat your cake, and the staff allowed me and my friend to just stand and eat at the corner of the shop by the door.   

Again, I know this is San Francisco, a city with a shortage of custom-made cake joints, but for the price you charge, you can do better.
author: Colette C.

description:
A cute little cake shop next to a parking garage.  The Whole Cakes name must refer to the fact that there are very few slices for sale.  A little troubling for the casual afternoon snacker, but what I was fortunate enough sample was quite tasty.

Double Chocolate Cake: Not sure where the "double" comes from.  There's fluffy chocolate cake, whipped cream and some raspberries and strawberries.  Compared to those buttercream frosting cake places, this felt very light.  Guess it's perfect for when you want something sweet, but not too heavy.  Though when you do want something indulgently heavy, you'll feel a little disappointed for $6.

Crepe Layered Cake w/ Mixed Berry: Now this is the cake slice you need to get, if it is available.  Why settle for one measly crepe when you have tons stacked on top of each other with only a thin layer of whipped cream and berry bits between.  Each forkful separates off a host of little crepe bits for a texture experience unlike anything you've had before.  Seriously better than the traditional cakey cakes here.

Signature Green Tea Cake w/ Mango: I can see why this is their signature, it's unique and delicious.  The cake is heavily infused with matcha, giving it a nice roasted umami flair.  The mango floating in the whipped cream layers add an indulgently sweet contrast.  No buttercream frosting regret because this flavor combo is never found at buttercream-centric cake shops.
author: Adam B.

description:
It was Chinese New Year and my family friends had a potluck get together so I volunteered to bring dessert. I heard about Whole Cakes from a friend who buys cakes for all her events because it's not as sweet which suits Asian palates. Prices are higher than other bakeries but they use organic ingredients.

I ordered 3 cakes: Green Tea with Pear, Strawberry and Chocolate. I picked them up a day before the dinner and went home and wrapped the boxes in plastic (to keep them from drying out overnight in the fridge).

The cakes were a hit with the Aunties and Uncles at the party. They loved that they weren't too sweet but still so flavorful and pretty to look at.
author: Nette T.

description:
So simple, so tasty, so light, so NOT overly sweet (but so expensive). 

 6" cake costs either $33 or $38. Hopefully you can use your corporate card to buy your coworker/boss a birthday cake from here. 

Call ahead because cakes do run out. 

I recommend the walnut pecan and matcha cake. The sesame one sounds good too, hope I'll get to try it soon.
author: Dana Z.

description: 2.5, rounding down to 2.  I've been here three times and won't come again.  Super expensive (i.e. $6 for a smaller than avg. individual piece of cake), and also extremely unfriendly service all three times.  Cold/weird vibe every time.  The staff makes me feel like they're annoyed to have to help me even though I'm the only customer and am simply asking what the items are that are displayed.  I'd come back if I felt welcome. There are a million other places to choose from in SF, and service is everything especially if what you're serving is mediocre.
author: Paula E.

description:
We ordered a birthday cake for a colleague from here, an 8" "Zesty Real Early Gray" cake and it was exceptionally good. Excellent texture, perfectly finished icing and the perfect size for our whole team. 

I went back a few days later and ordered a matcha latte (having seen it advertised there the first time) and that was so-so. But that teaches me a lesson for ordering a latte from a cake shop. It's a dangerous place to visit first thing in the morning - they have trays of freshly baked muffins and cupcakes cooling by the window that are hard to resist.

Anyway, 5* for the cake, 3* for the drink.
author: Sunil S.

description:
Such a bummer. I really wanted to like this place because it's such a cute little bakery near my work. I came here to purchase a small 4 inch cake and found a really cute strawberry cake. The cake is basically ALL frosting/cream. There's a thin middle layer of cake and another thin layer on the bottom. The frosting is not too sweet but the breading is sweeter so it balances out. Frosting was light and creamy whereas the breading was a little dense.  It tasted like any regular cake. I didn't find anything special about it. 

The reason for the 2 stars is because 1) I felt like it was so overpriced for such a small cake. It was $17 flat for a 4 inch cake and 2) when I got home and was getting ready to light the candles on the cake, I found a piece of hair on the frosting!! It was so gross. I had to scrape off the whole top layer of frosting because of the hair because I didn't want to let the cake go to waste since I paid so much for such a tiny cake. 

All in all, I didn't find anything special about their cakes even though I've read so many great yelp reviews about it. Maybe I just got the wrong cake. Who knows, maybe one day I'll decide to give them another chance.
author: Anna D.

description:
I stumbled upon this place looking to sit down and have some coffee and a quick bite to satisfy my sweet craving. 

[The cafe/Service] 
This quaint little place caught my eye immediately. Has a very asian-esque feel to it and lots of gluten free options as well. The cakes looked beautiful in the display window and immediately I could tell that this was the type of place that gets large cake orders. Service was friendly. 

[The cake]
I didn't feel that the cake was amazing especially given the price. 6.00 for one slice of strawberry vanilla cake...The slices were on the smaller side as well. The whipped cream was very tasty but the cake seemed kind of dry. 

I also got a hand drip coffee for about 5 dollars and this coffee was superb! It had a nice roasted flavor and the taste was bold. I really enjoyed this coffee, probably 3 times more than I enjoyed the cake. 

Overall, the coffee was on point, but for the price and quality of the cake, I think I would pass.
author: Emily T.

description:
My wife and I were really craving a crepe layered cake. In the past, we've had a slice of the tiramisu cake which was good as well.

We decided to place an order for the vanilla flavored cake, and asked the patissier to add more cream between the layers than their current recipe. Sonya was great helping us place an order and pick up on the same day!

The cake was so great and it was definitely perfect for our one year anniversary celebration. Thank you so much!
author: Gabriel S.

description:
A small cake shop in the SOMA area. I can see why people have bad experience with the cakes but i mean just go somewhere else if they don't have what you want or just don't go again next time. 

I honestly had a easy and great experience, staff and owner (Sonya ) is so nice and helpful. Answered questions that I had about certain cakes and flavors. I wished they made passionfruit crepe cake but they don't because they don't have organic passionfruit to make it. All of their cakes are made with organic ingredients only. I ordered the matcha crepe cake for my friends birthday and it was delicious! The price was around $60 for the whole cake which is a bit pricey but it was worth it! Each layer was made perfectly with amazing matcha flavors.

Overall it was a great experience and would come again. Just a heads up if you want them to write something on the cake, let them know ahead of time because they most likely won't do it on the spot and on the day. Long story short, just communicate everything ahead of time with them so you get a good experience!
author: Christopher G.

description:
Disappointed is an understatement. This business was completely unprofessional in handling my order and had no sympathy. I placed my order on a Monday online, and it didn't seem to go through. I immediately called to provide my order details over the phone and was told someone would call me back for payment details. Two days later and still no call. I called them back 3x with no answer. Finally a 4th time they answered and the line was crackling, but I got a confirmation that yes my order will be ready next day between 3-4pm. No one ever asked for payment details. Lo and behold I get there and no cake because I didn't provide payment details. I called multiple times to confirm my order and was never once asked by staff for my payment details. It's one thing to have a payment policy, but it's another to be so rude when I get there for my cake and tell me they just don't have a cake for me. People pre order cakes for special occasions, do not leave them hanging. The woman behind the counter didn't offer me any other pre-made cake and just told me they didn't make my cake because they didn't have my CC details. I called multiple times, I clearly wanted the cake. 

I'm disappointed in this business and the fact they didn't care that they left someone who was willing to pay (which was clearly the most important thing to them) hanging when I needed a cake for a special occasion.
author: Sarah K.

description: I have never tried anything like the layered mixed berries cake, ever, it was amazing! I special ordered it for my friend's "surprise" birthday ceremony :D and when it got reveilled, everybody loved it. The cake was so delicious and so creamy, everyone praised it and asked me about bakery store. I would definitely recommend Whole Cakes for such beautiful and delectable cakes. Thanks so much "Sonya n co"! I would love to visit again and try more varieties and flavors! =D
author: Nikhil G.

description:
I bought a 6 inch cake from this place for a work team meeting today. I got there at 7:45am. There was no line. The service was great. 
I didn't call ahead and order the cake ahead of the time, that's why the selection was limited. They only had one 6 inch cake that I bought. 

The taste of the cheesecake was just okay. It was very light. It was not the typical New York cheesecake style. The taste of cream cheese was light as well. 

Would recommend anyone to call ahead if you want something particular in the morning.
author: Rachael C.

description: The cakes here are the stuff dreams are made of - for real. Picked up an earl gray and peaches cake (6 inches for $33) at 5:58 pm on a Thursday at the last minute - at first the cake wasn't finished so they weren't going to sell it to me - but the lady there was SO NICE that she stayed late to finish it and gave it to me by 6:10. The cake itself was beyond delicious - light, fluffy and the flavors were so delicate. It was for 8 people but I could've eaten that whole thing by myself and not even felt terrible after!
author: Sam M.

description:
A cute little store with a ton of things I can't wait to indulge in. First of all, if you're into really sweet cakes this place isn't for you at all.  However, I love that there's a tinge of sweetness.  Very Asian-like. 

I tried the crepe cake and the raspberry, strawberry, and chocolate cake. Though the crepe cake was interesting, I think the chocolate cake was way better. The cream was amazing. 

At $6 a slice, this place isn't cheap. But I wouldn't mind coming back once in a while on a work break. Make sure you come earlier because the options were a lot sparser at 4 pm. I heard the strawberry vanilla and matcha are amazing cakes.
author: Shannon L.

description: This is an odd place and I don't know what to think.  Everything that I have purchased there, and eaten, has been wonderful.  I have loved the food.  However, it is an awkward, small place with awkward people.  I met a young woman who was from Michigan and very nice, then, never saw her again.  They didn't get my order right once and I could tell it was going to be a hassle to straighten it out, so I just let it go.  I am unsure but I think there is an Asian lady in charge who is not quite acclimated to life in America.  Things are just off, but I love their cakes.
author: Ralph B.

description:
So I was going around cake tasting to find my mum the perfect birthday cake. I saw this bakery and their cakes were gorgeous. 

I walked in and was greeted right away by the cashier. On the other side of him was an asian woman, i believe the owner and baker, frosting cakes. I asked if I could sample some slices and what flavors they had available today ($6 per slice) and I was pointed to a poorly organized board showing what flavors are made for every day of the week. However the board I was pointed to had incorrect information and was quite difficult to read..

I not only was the set up and organization poor in my opinion but the cashier didnt really know what he was doing. He had to ask the owner for help with all my questions. On top of this the owner was cold and rude in her responses.. 

I could forgive an offputting experience for a delicious and beautiful cake though so i sampled a small 4" round of the strawberry vanilla cake ($17 roughly).

However the expensive cake was not only about 85% whipped cream but the bottom later was dryyyy like the freaking Sahara Desert. The layer of cake on top was moist but only because they put some liquid (the owner was very adamant it was not simple syrup.....) in there. In fact the liquid made the top layer wet...

Its quite sad that their cakes were so inconsistent. The taste was good, just some technical flaws I previously outlined that were hard to look past given the price. On top of the less than welcoming service it would be hard for me to go back.
author: Megan L.

description: I had really high hopes for this place but I was disappointed. However, I will try any other cake because I am hopeful to give this place more stars. I got the carrot cake. Both cake and cream was lacking in taste. The worst part was that each layer of cream was thicker than the thin layers of cake. The smallest cake is $19. It's a hefty price for the size but if it was really good, it would have been well worth it. All I tasted was cream. The other person that ate a bite quickly told me to stop eating it because he thought it was that bad. I also got the cranberry cookies - they were delicious, soft, moist and full of butter (prob a tad too much butter) so I gave this rating an extra star for that.
author: Gloria T.

description: Wanted to come for the crepe cakes but they only had one flavor which I wasn't really interested in trying. Got the earl grey peach cake instead and did not regret it. Really creamy and moist. Would be nice to have a larger selection of cakes.
author: Fily C.

description:
We do tons of birthday celebrations at work.  Whole Cakes have been my go-to bakery since they always deliver on time and their cakes are tasty and not too sweet.  

Though they prefer not to, I've even been able to get same day cake deliveries with them through Postmates.

Service is always REALLY odd.  Their online site says deliver is $100, which I've called and they said they do that to force people to call in.  Then you call in, spend 15 minutes talking to them since it takes a while to take down an order...THEN they figure out if they can deliver or not.  Sometimes the answer is no...both of us have already wasted 15 minutes, and then they tell us to go through postmates.  

Sometimes they have us pay them, sometimes postmates.  

Hopefully they can work out the kinks a bit better.
author: Vi Y.

description:
What you pay is what you get!

Of course you can go get the more affordable cakes at a Safeway or Costco filled with whipped cream that'll make you go "I'm good" after one bite. Or you can get Whole Cakes where you can't get enough of their cakes. Their whipped cream on their cakes doesn't feel greasy, it actually feels light!

I order their cakes for my office's monthly birthday cakes and they are amazing. I try to be as accommodating as they are to me. Sonya is super sweet and she tries her best to make as many tasty cakes as she can in a day so everybody is happy. Henry answers all of my questions over email and tries his best to be time flexible in terms of deliveries.

Their cakes are organic and delicious, so if you're looking to splurge a little for your loved ones or yourself, look no further. I highly recommend Whole Cakes ever since I started ordering their cakes in October 2016. They never disappoint!

So far I've had their Very Berry Blueberry, Black Sesame & Soybean, and Coffee Lover's Mocha. I've got to say their Very Berry Blueberry cake is the most popular one so far among my coworkers. I'm going to try their Strawberry cake next month to see which is better, but until then! 

Price: On average a 10" cake is $75 + $10 delivery fee. BUT! It was feeding my team of 30! Given there were probably 20 people actually eating it but it's worth it because it's delicious and they deliver if you are nearby!

Location: Beware their location on Google Maps is very misleading! It took me to the building of Sausalito Cafe and I was lost for a little bit. Then I found it right next to the parking garage entrance! It's not very large so you'll miss it if you walk too fast like me ;P
author: Kimberly W.

description:
There's a lot of service improvement since I left a review about my concerns on last month. The owner take the guest review seriously, I have seen great improvement for their service: professionally greeting their guests, making sure they have birthday candles available, ask if the guest needs their receipts etc. 

I recently purchased their chocolate cake, and their strawberry chiffon cake. I had to order in advance, but it's available. Both cakes are amazingly fresh and delicious - it was perfect. The price of the cake is reasonable in SF downtown area. I'll be definitely coming back often, I hope to continue supporting local shops. They've got gluten free cakes and their cake has no butter, organic, and it's healthy. I'll be back again soon. If you like light fluffy fresh ingredient cake, this place is unique and worth to drop by!
author: Karen C.

description:
Highlights
- Their cakes are minimalistic, but oh so beautiful and tasted very fresh with their organic/locally sourced ingredients. They aren't overly sweet and have just the right amount of sweetness. 
- After passing by numerous times and seeing their adorable mini cakes in their display, I had a mission to stop and go get it one afternoon during lunch. Only two options to choose from in the display case, either a mini strawberry vanilla or double chocolate, but the cashier said only the strawberry was available since the chocolate wasn't ready.
- The cake even after a day in the fridge was light and fluffy, perfect amount of the sweetness and generous strawberry slices on the sides for decor as well as chopped strawberries in the center of the cake. Yum!

Improvements
- After I mentioned I wanted the mini strawberry cake, the cashier said it would take 10 mins to finish it. I obliged to realize that 10 mins was taken to place a about 4 mini pieces of fruit and some shavings of zest on top. Quality takes time and for the price, I guess.
- Definitely not a regular thing to get, since you are paying for the quality, but quite worth it. Just factor in time and order in advance. 

Tips
- They also offer teas, smoothies, coffee, pastries, and cookies. Their cookies (esp. earl grey shortbread) are just the amount of sweetness and delicious.
author: Tracy T.

description: I am so disappoint the way they made my aniversary cake..thought I order cheap one they could have atleast made that anniversary notation a good looked....
author: Shirish S.

description: Had high hopes for the cakes here, but alas it was just pricey. The single slices are more like sample size slices for folks used to American slice cakes and are gone with 2 big bites from a big mouthed person.  Butter seems to be omitted so there are no worries about calories but is it that hard to cover rent in the area that they'd cut slices so tiny? All in all, I feel it's overrated. For the price it should be 3 times as big.  Novel flavors and decent taste though, maybe tech folks with money to burn will keep this store open for years to come as the price for tiny studio apartments rise to over $2,000 in SF, Ca.
author: Ken K.

description:
My fault I went at end of day on Sept 26, but that's when my partner was born, and I didn't plan ahead. I looked for a bakery near fiDi that didn't make Crisco frosting and was still open. After finding the storefront, I found their selection was one cake. It was nutty and wholesome. If I were buying a birthday cake for a health conscious individual, it would be perfect. But even for my not-worried-about-that-kind-of-thing partner, it was a lovely little cake with lots of texture. 
Next time, I'll order ahead for the chocolate cake though.
author: Char Z.

description:
Delightful bakery filled with delightful treats! 

My colleagues and I came in after a team lunch one afternoon and salivated over all of the beautiful baked options. They have large cakes, small cakes, and slices in a variety of flavors to choose from. It was tough to decide but ultimately we all realized that we each really only wanted a few bites of something sweet so we decided to get one small cake (vs. individual slices) and dig into it together. 

We settled on the strawberry cake piped with a light whipped cream based frosting. The cake was perfect for what we had in mind. Not too heavy, perfectly light (only fresh berries here!). The cake was spongy and just the right amount of airy. I quite liked it.

Exactly what you want in a midafternoon treat!
author: Annette J.

description:
Despite its name, I've yet to buy a whole cake from here. I usually come here to buy their cookies: either to treat myself to a little afternoon snack or because I want to treat a co-worker who deserved some kind of appreciation. (Their match cookies are great.)

What I particularly like about this place is that you can see the staff at work. In fact, chances are high that when you come here in the afternoon, they're in the midst of decorating a cake.
author: Uli B.

description:
So worth it.

Almond honey cake....it might be a bit more wholesome than others...but but it is the taste that is worth it.

You can taste the almonds.

Not almond flavor..but almonds.

Yes I had small one to "test" before I ordered two large ones for a lunch I was hosting.

Highly recommended!!!!
author: Dani K.

description:
Last minute need for a cake and WOW!
Had the crepe cake for an office celebration and everyone gobbled it up. Also had some cookies and now everyone asks when we will have more. 
Everyone at the shoppe is super friendly and helpful. We will be testing the whole menu. Thank yuh!
author: Laura H.

description:
Lately I've been baking most of my own desserts and that's what I had planned to do for last night's large family gathering. But the lemon buttermilk bundt cake I'd imagined never quite came to fruition over the weekend. And thus I found myself at my desk Monday morning asking my colleagues for suggestions. 

Enter, Whole Cakes. 

I rang before lunch and asked them what they had on offer to serve 10. The woman on the phone rattled off a few delicious sounding options but really caught my attention with "crepe cake". This delight is composed of 20 layers of crepes. I chose vanilla but you can get matcha, coffee, chocolate or fruity yogurt (yogurt mousse cream and seasonal fruit).

The crepe cake was a hit with our family (I saw folks going back for seconds) and I loved how light and not overly sweet it was. Whole Cakes certainly saved me with this day of order!
author: Miriam W.

description: Ordered a cake here for my coworkers baby shower. They were super helpful and the price wasn't so bad! When you walk past you probably wouldn't notice it. It's has a hole in the wall sort of feel but I loved it. I walk past it now and I always remember the cake that I ordered and feel happy. Thanks guys! I don't think I have any pictures of the cake but believe me it was worth it.
author: Olivia P.

description: This is hands down my FAVORITE place for cakes in the bay area!! I can't tell you how delicious everything they make is, you just have to try for yourself! The cream they use in their cakes is to die for, so well balanced and light! There's also an amazing mix of cream/cake/fruits & chocolate! I must say I really look for occasions to buy a cake from this place, it's a real treat!
author: Rachida I.

description: These guys have perfected the art of the not-overly-sweet cake. We get these all the time at work and they are sublime. You could probably eat a handful of their frosting by itself -- no judgment -- and not instantly become super-diabetic (hyper-diabetic? Is that a thing?). What I'm saying is that you'll love their cakes, assuming you don't have the palette of a six-year-old boy raised on Super Sugar Corn Pops (Yes, that was a real cereal name once).
author: Peter C.

description:
Whole Cakes did me a huge solid by getting a super last minute order done beautifully and on time on a Monday when they were very busy. Thank you so much! It was for a bridal shower at work, and the cake was lovely and delicious, enjoyed very much by all. It was the strawberry one, I forget the exact name. Next time I want to try a chiffon cake, because those are amazing and somewhat rare to find.

Highly recommend checking this place out (and placing your order the day before at least.)
author: Katrina R.

description:
Hands down my favorite place ever.

A coworker introduced the earl grey peach cake to me for the first time and seriously, it was mind-blowing. The cake had a great balance of flavor, while also being very light and sophisticated. I was so impressed that I had to buy more for my family to try.

If you give them a call at least 24 hours in advance, you can get a cake. I called them on a Thursday morning for a Friday afternoon pickup and it went super smoothly. I couldn't get the earl grey peach cake, but their signature green tea cake was just as divine. BUT, my favorite is still the earl grey peach. Definitely get that if it's available.
author: Jenny H.

description:
I want to like this little bakery sooo bad. I love the concept of using all organic ingredients, and quite frankly, I have no issue shelling out more money for higher quality BUT when the taste is not on par with the high price tag it loses all justification. I've ordered cakes with them in the past and sometimes it's good sometimes it's not. The inconsistency has left me questioning if I should order any more birthday cakes here on out. If I'm buying a $60+ cake for a special occasion it better be damn good.

My recent visit happened last week when I placed an order for two cakes: one crepe cake, the other black sesame. I LOVE crepe cake. Not too many bakeries carry mille crepe cake. In fact, the only other bakery I know that specializes in crepe cake is Anton SV Patisserie in SJ. Despite not opening on weekends, I purposely planned a surprise birthday get-together during the week so I can pick up a fresh crepe cake from this bakery. To my surprise, the crepe layers were too thick and the taste of dough overpowered the filling. What made it worse, the second cake I ordered was very dry and bland. It had almost no hint of black sesame in either the cake or frosting and could've used more sugar. I was pretty disappointed in both cakes.

I feel like I've given Whole Cakes many chances to improve the taste and quality of their product but the wow factor for each cake falls short every time. I don't know if I will order another cake from this bakery which sucks because their shop is right next door to my work.
author: Mary M.

description:
We love this bakery!

Cakes are superb. Service is prompt, staff is friendly, and what more can I say, go get yourself a slice of cake, or even a whole cake. 

You will not be disappointed!
author: Eduardo L.

description: Caaaaaake! Cute little bakery to grab a slice or whole cake for a special occasion. I was having lunch with my co-workers and we decided to buy a small strawberry fruit cake to share at the office. The shop itself is insanely tiny and there's a woman in the front that you can watch make a cake. The dessert itself was a light white cake with fresh strawberries and lots of whipped cream. Not the tastiest cake I've ever had but still a nice midday treat and perfect for your next special occasion!
author: Emi H.

description: I don't really care about sweets but these are delicious because they don't slap you in the face with sugar. It tastes naturally sweet. Glad to have tried the chocolate raspberry cake and apple almond tart. Good stuff!
author: Marcus G.

description:
We ordered three 4in cakes,

In order of preference
#1 Dark chocolate with Raspberry
#2 Strawberry and Vanilla
#3 Green Tea Matcha 

All three cakes were indeed airy, light on sweetness and tasted pure. The downside was that the green tea had very little flavor and the cake was bland. With the strawberry and vanilla cake, way too much cream and not enough body. The dark chocolate was definitely the best of the three

Overall Thoughts

I'm hard press to come back for a repeat try simply because nothing was "Wow that's freaking delicious, I need more"
author: Eddie W.

description: All I get from the owner's response is reasons why the cake is so expensive.  Yes yes we get it you use only the finest organic ingredients blah blah.  Let's clarify one thing, if the cake was super delicious I would totally shell out cash for the quality but my chief complaint wasn't addressed that being the cake was just too dry.  Do not recommend.
author: Amy C.

description: Not open at 7, coffee and muffins with the place looking like they are closed. Bummer, at least the door is open and the lights are dimmed.
author: Ernesto L.

description: So glad that I found this spot! Got to order a cake for pickup last minute for my brothers birthday. Their cakes are beautiful and I love how they are made out of quality ingredients. I got the green tea chiffon cake which was paired with a mango creme for the day as the seasonal fruit. The amount of cream to cake ratio is off, way too much cream for me, and their whipped cream frosting is deliciously light! Also, I would have wanted more fruit in/on my cake as well. When we got home with the cake, we decorated it more with raspberries on top, which gave it a nice tart kick as well. Overall, the place is pretty top notch and I'll be here again for special events!
author: Annie S.

description: I've been wanting to try this bakery for a few months now. Ordered a cake on Monday and I was able to pick up the next day, hooray! The only real issue I had was the presentation. Since this was a birthday cake, I was hoping that there would be a little more effort placed into the design/execution of the cake - the tag with the greeting sunk into the frosting. But back to the positives - the green tea cake I ordered was delicious! It wasn't so sweet that people were bouncing off walls and the flavors weren't overwhelming. The pear paired with the cake was a surprising and sophisticated touch. I'll definitely come back to try other flavors!
author: Ida H.

description:
We ordered a wedding cake from Whole Cakes back in late June for my brother's wedding. After several exchange of emails with Sonia the owner and master baker, we were able to set the design, flavors, and delivery time well before wedding date. 

I gave them the guests number, location of the venue (indoor), styles and design we like--rustic. She then offered some suggestions for flavor, tier, decors, flowers etc. Sonia gave me the flexibility to bring in flowers and she would decorate the cake for me. I bought my flowers from Elizabeth's Flowers nearby--really fresh and great shape beautiful flowers though a bit expensive ($100), but well worth it! I then passed the flowers to Sonia, and the rest is all taken care of!

They delivered the cake to our wedding venue perfectly on time and the cake is in great shape. All natural ingredients and beautiful design. Although there are limitation to what a baker can do without the fondants, they did an amazing job--a rustic style with natural flowers on top that showcase classy charm. 

I chose the style based on their pictures on Instagram and modified a little--I took the shortcut :) but it worked out great! :)
author: S N.

description:
Super stunning and minimal cakes! 

I called in today to inquire about their cakes for a last minute celebration and they had one available for me to pick up right away. (:

I ended up with the Matcha cake with a whipped cream frosting and pear filling. It was so so good! The best cake I've ever had! The matcha flavor was present, the pears were amazing, and everything was just light, fluffy, and not too sweet.  It was DEVOURED by everyone at the office! Everyone wanted to know where I got it! 

The staff was super nice about serving me, made everything super easy to handle. 

Overall I had a great experience, if I had anything to complain about it would be that they couldn't write "happy birthday" on the cake for me because it was a same day order. Oh it was also a bit pricey? $50 for a 8in cake is pretty steep. 

Otherwise I'd love to come back to try the crepe cake and some of the cookies!
author: Maggie Y.

description: Very good cake place. If you are like me enjoying cakes that are not that sweet, this is the place. The cake is very high quality, fresh, moist.
author: Cindy J.

description:
Best. Cake. Ever. Ordered two cakes in a week for celebratory events and Whole Cakes came through with 2 delicious cakes. The strawberry cream cake is delicious, and the double chocolate cake is beyond amazing. The whipped cream is light and airy, chocolate cake moist, and the raspberry filling was fresh. 

I love that all of the cakes are made from locally sourced, organic ingredients that doesn't make you sick after pigging out. Customer service is excellent as well. Big shout out to Sonya for being so accommodating and making a memorable cake with fresh flower toppings.
author: Jessica K.

description: If you prefer light and airy cakes over dense and heavy cakes, this is your cake shop! :) Admittedly, the cakes here are not cheap, but everything tastes fresh and just the right amount of sweetness (I personally don't like overly sweet desserts!). I've not tried the crepe cake (it was sold out the two times I've been here!) but maybe third time's the charm :)
author: Claire S.

description:
Happiness is eating chiffon cake that's light, airy and fluffy.  Double happiness when you're able to reign in your cravings for a whole cake by being limited by just one slice.

My co-worker directed me to Whole Cakes awhile back and after waffling for so long on whether I should go in or not, I finally mustered up the courage to go in and much to my surprise (and happiness), I was able to purchase one of their delectable cakes by the slice. Hooray! The 'Light Chocolate' chiffon cake wasn't overly sweet, which made eating it an easy task.  As far as their other items go, I also had their Matcha Shortbread cookie, which I thought was OK and I'd probably go with something a little sweeter for next time since this was sort of on the bitter side (which makes sense though..green tea isn't sweet). In any case, I can't wait to try a few of their other options! Now if someone could please have a special occasion where I can buy an entire cake and share it so that I don't have to make up an occasion where I end up eating it all by myself, that'd be great ;)
author: Lisa I.

description: So my boyfriend got me this year's birthday cake from here. And boy, was it taste-bud-blowing!! I'm a chocolate cake kinda person and I love it more if my chocolate cakes had that whipped icing that looks less like chocolate but tastes a lot like it (y'know what I mean?) yeah well that's what these guys had. And I ended up having one of the best birthday cakes of my life. We devoured it in 10 mins!
author: Annie T.

description: Yummmy wholesome cakes. Bought a small cake for my son as a surprise and he loved it. I don't like things that are too sweet and this one wasn't and yet amazying ingredients we ordered the strawberry cream cake and the taste was amazing
author: Carmen C.

description: Sonya put together a stunning and delicious cake for my Chinese wedding banquet!  I searched high and low for a bakery that could provide Asian-style cakes, which tend to be lighter and less sweet (fitting for a post-12-course banquet), but with a more modern design.  I found just that at Whole Cakes.  I ordered the raspberry citrus chiffon cake, which had whipped cream instead of buttercream, and it felt like eating a refreshing and fluffy cloud!  All of my guests were in love with that cake!  Thanks, Sonya!  P.S.  The carrot cake is also really special at Whole Cakes!
author: Christina K.

description:
A cake is supposed to make people happy, and is usually a part of all special celebrations, right??? Well, not here. I don't know who or what sucked all the happiness and nice souls of the staff here, but they are so snappy and grumpy. 

Service: I came here so excited to buy their cake for my mom and grandma. Since it was my first time, I asked few questions with a smile on my face... In return, their response was very unfriendly and snappy. All in all, I think they have an attitude and got their popularity to their head. 

Cake: Since I needed a last minute cake, I just bought the Coffee Lover's Cake because she kept saying most of their cakes on the display were "not on sale." Also I saw them writing on a cake for customer who was currently waiting in the store, so I requested if they can write on mine too. "We can't write on the same day orders." This is the first time hearing it in any cake shop or bakery EVER. I mean how hard is it to write? It wasn't even busy besides one other customer before me. Anyways the cake didn't taste as good as I expected. It had a minimal flavor, I guess only thing I liked about it wasn't too sweet.

If they were actually friendly and welcoming, I was planning to come try their other cakes, but I will not be returning to this cake shop solely based on the service. I would have overlooked the service, if their cakes at least tasted mind-blowing. Oh well, methinks not!
author: Solongo B.

description: DO NOT MAKE MY MISTAKE! I had to order a sheet cake for a work party and since they are around the corner, I walked over with a typed up order, 2 weeks in advance! They took my order and said they would follow-up in email. Four days before the event, I called to check AND THEY LOST MY ORDER!  The 'chef' wouldn't even talk to me directly, she had the counter person apologize and blame the janitor for throwing it away. Unbelievable. Thank goodness for THE CAKE GALLERY who is saving the day by filling a last minute order.
author: Lisa G.

description: I find it strange that they won't let you sample before placing a large order. If I'm catering to entire my team or office, I'd like to be able to try before I buy. I will be taking my business elsewhere.
author: Nicole I.

description:
Woohoo!!! Finally a bakery in SF that doesn't make me wish I'd bought a Safeway cake instead :') 

I called in a day in advance to place an order for a 4" Strawberry Vanilla cake and was initially told that cake requests should be made at least 2-3 days in advance (depending on the cake too)... so I prepared myself to be disappointed....... but after a short little side conversation the person on the phone had with someone else in the bakery, they agreed to take my order!!!! YAY for such quick and clear customer service.

The cake was $17 and they asked for payment on the phone. I arrived the next day to pick it up and saw that indeed, that 4" cake is TINY (The width is maybe 1" larger than the mouth of a red Solo cup)... BUT!!! I think it was a perfect fit for my family of four (since we hate wasting cake). Also, I found it a little ridiculous that the 6" version is almost twice the price... so for those of you that want to take home a tiny tasting cake, I recommend the 4"!!! The price is decent for what you get.  

Fluffy and light whipped cream with soft yellow cake (moistened in something subtly sweet, which made it delightful!!) and freshly picked fruit... it was wonderful!

ALSO... the cakes are BEAUTIFUL!! Great for those photo ops ;)
author: Gloria P.

description: I bought the double chocolate cake for a birthday, transported it home by BART, unloaded into the fridge for the following day. Following day cake was as fresh, light and moist as if I'd just bought it. Very successful birthday treat. Fresh strawberry in the cake filling was a surprise and very refreshing. One of the best cakes I've tasted in a long while.
author: Ben Z.

description: Make sure you count your items before leaving the shop. Was short-counted on my cookies today; called them to notify and didn't even receive an appropriate apology - was told "mistakes happen". Maybe it was just an off day for the bakery because everything tasted pretty mediocre today :( not worth the big bill!
author: Valerie P.

description: Cakes are delicious,healthy and well-made. Just the girls behind counters seem so miserable. Even though you give tips wouldn't make them happy. Please~~~~ a happy environment for a cake shop is also very important. I wish you all work happily over there.
author: Lisa C.

description: Not impressed! We love crepe cakes having tried the Lady M version.  The Whole Cakes version pales in comparison.  There wasn't much cream so the taste was pretty much just the  crepe itself with a small hint of cream. Crepes were thicker than what I am used to.   I ordered a crepe cake, a special request from my son on his bday.  I should have had it shipped from Lady M but decided to give this a try. Their version doesnt have a caramelized top, the edges of the crepe cake where showing.  I was very very disappointed when I got home and got a first look. It looked so sloppy.  I requested them to put a special  Happy Birthday decoration on the cake.  I was hoping they would decorate it similar to what they have pictured online but no they did not decorate it at all.  All they did was a measly Times Roman lettering "Happy 15 Chris".   They forgot to write birthday.  It should have been Happy 15th Birthday!  They went extremrly minimalist with nothing but just small letterings.  It was pathetic and very disappointing for the amount of money I paid.  I wouldn't recommend this if you're looking at celebratory cakes, no creativity.  All they got going is the "organic" theme. Didn't really matter to me coz didn't really get to taste much of the Strauss cream on the crepe cake. Never again. Crepe cake is not cheap and this one was definitely not worth it.  UGHH. Don't, just don't!!
author: Cj P.

description: I tried this place for first time last Thursday. It was refreshing to find friendly people and good customer service in the city. They were accommodating and prompt. They practically made the cake in front of me and it delicious! Very fresh, not overly sweet. I ordered the strawberry but would love to try more flavors. The only thing I would improve on is the sampling. If you had different sizes, including smaller individual size. Overall I recommend this place.
author: Cozima C.

description:
San Francisco FiDi prices shouldn't shock me anymore.  I mean, I've been working this district for almost 9 years and spending $10+ for lunch is the norm.  No problem there.  So, you would think shelling out $5 bucks for a thin 1" slice of chocolate cake would be easy breezy, right?  WRONG!  

I was craving a piece of decadent chocolate cake for days and remember walking by this petite little cake shop.  I walked in and was pleasantly greeted by everyone.  My eyes immediately zoned into the slices of chocolate cakes and I said, 1 please.  After the nice cashier packs the cake in cute packaging...

She says -- That'll be $5
Me says -- Excuse me?
She says -- $5

Bullets of sweat start penetrating through my pores from the mere mention of $5.  I pull out a ten and hand it over.  INSTANTLY, I regretted  not asking for the price before telling them I wanted a slice.  I was in the "too late, too bad, you outta luck" stage.

With my cute little box on hand, I walked back to the office to eat it.  Okay, I gotta admit, the cake was pretty good.  It was moist, chocolaty, light on the cream, fresh on the raspberries BUT DAMNIT, it was only 1 freakin' inch thick!!!  I've never seen a 1 inch thick cake before.  The only time and I mean the ONLY time it should be 1 inch thick is when you buy the entire 10" round cake and attempt to feed 15+ people with it.  That's the ONLY time!!!  Otherwise, the traditional cut is triangular and that's the only way a piece of cake should be sold.  

The slice took 7 bites to finish, that's about $0.71 per bite.  My goodness.  Lesson learned... ask for the price before you bite.  It'll eliminate the "OMG" moment...

5 STARS for flavors and service
-1 STAR due to price and 7-bite 1" thick cake slice
author: Jenny T.

description:
Their shortbread cookies are amazing (especially the earl grey olive oil)! Delicious pastries that are made with good ingredients and aren't diabetes in waiting are so hard to find. 
My friend got a birthday cake from here and it was ridiculously good. I usually hate cake, but this little almond cake was worth coming back for! 
I'm so surprised to see bad reviews on the service here. I'm a small youngish person too, but everyone who works there has always been just friendly enough so that I feel welcomed into a magical little cake land, but not too in your face so I don't feel pressured to get something. 
People who are upset about the price should probably look at the prices before they buy... You pay for taste and quality. It's like expecting to pay Burger King prices at a Michelin Star restaurant because they both serve food.
author: Nadine G.

description: I've almost forgotten that place.  It's smells very fresh every time I enter.  Despite the small space, it's a very lovely atmosphere: hand baked pastries, Rishi teas, and three beautiful Chinese American ladies running the bakery shop called the "Whole Cakes".  My favorite bakery shop has pastries made with organic local ingredients.  It's like the sustainable version of " Fancy Wheat Fields " in SoMa.  This place has to stay for business.  I love it!  I wanted to buy a birthday cake one day.
author: Jimmy C.

description: The cakes they have are delicious! So light, fluffy, and full of flavor! I always order cakes here for my bosses and they always enjoy them. A must for any celebration if you're tired of the same old chocolate cake. Be sure to preorder as they don't always keep the popular cakes in the display!
author: Felicia F.

description:
I sincerely hope their baked goods are better than their customer service. Unfortunately Ill never find out. I contacted them to see about having a wedding cake made. 

Fast forward a week later after numerous promises of a reply by email or phone and I finally have an email detailing little more than the information already provided on their website. Then a brief phone call which included a cold and emotionless receptionist, a few minutes on hold and my favorite of the whole experience a few minutes talking to the owner. I explained that I was having our reception in SF but that we lived a few hours away and would need to arrange the whole thing remotely. I had also previously sent over a few pictures of cake ideas I liked via email. The reply I kept getting to my questions was to "refer to the email I sent you". 

Here is an exact cut and paste from the end of their email:
"I hope this is enough information at this point, and look forward to discussing more"

I was also told I would need to come in for a tasting, and when I reiterated that I really didn't think  that was necessary and that I lived a considerable distance away the snarky and frankly smart ass reply I received was "..what, you're just going to trust me?" and "so how do you think we should proceed then?"

Well at the point the answer was no, I'm not going to trust you nor proceed to give you my business. Up to this point every person I had hired to work this wedding had been the first person I had spoken to. They had all been very accommodating, understanding and easy to work with. This place and the owner have been and probably will be the only exception. 

So in short, if you want to be treated like a nuisance by someone who cant run a business then this is the place! Judging by some of the other reviews that also complain about shoddy management and rude customer service I wouldn't expect to even see this place open in a year. You're in a competitive market in a major urban area. Act like it.
author: Nick L.

description: Love the matcha cookie and almond zucchini muffins!
author: Tony T.

description:
I called in to order over the phone. I believe I called after closing but was still helped with friendly service. I ordered 2 cakes for deliver. The delivery fee was definitely worth it. Saves me the hassle of trying to find somewhere to park or take the bus carrying the cakes myself. 

I really liked the different style of flavors they offer such as sweet potato, but it is a special order cake so you must order at least 1 day in advance.

Definitely satisfied with the service: I'll trust the birthday girl I got the cakes for regarding the flavors :)
author: Myron L.

description:
This bakery is great.  Upon walking in, we were greeted with a friendly hello (and a delicious aroma).  Nice first impression.  The staff was attentive and helpful.  We were seeking a wedding cake, and they accommodated us with samples (and addressed our questions and suggestions).  We ended up ordering a carrot cake, which features a delicious light frosting.  Couldn't have been better.

We'll be back in the future!
author: Brian O.

description: LOVE their cakes. The only thing I'd point out is that their service isn't the best. The workers don't really greet you and they take SO long cutting a slice of cake. But their cakes so good it's worth it!
author: Grace L.

description:
Their cakes are delicious.  However, the owner is consistently impolite and service is bad-- one time asked for a certain cupcake and she said it wasn't for sale, one time we asked for a cake made and she told us it would take 2 days to make it, one time we asked to buy a cake (*any* cake) for a birthday party and she said that's not how we sell cakes.  After each of these the owner never followed up with an alternative suggestion.
We joke about how this person is like the Soup-Nazi from Seinfeld.
author: Philip F.

description: I've gotten two cakes in the past few weeks for work.  Both were delicious. The crepe cake is very delicate and feels special. The double chocolate was light and flavorful and the cream was the perfect foil. I have extremely high standards for baked good and can't wait to see how else Whole Cake exceeds them.
author: Samara L.

description:
It was ok. Nothing really special for me as I am used to Asian style cake. Not too sweet with fresh whipped cream. For 2 days at work 2 differnt occasion coworker ordered the strawberry cake. The cake itself was so dense and dry! Luckily is was sliced thin about 1/4" to 3/8" cake layers then loaded with fresh whipped cream. I had the green tea cake before and it was good.

The good thing is their cake is not overly sweet. It is actually not sweet if you are used to sugary frosting.
author: Vivi C.

description: Three letters... YUM! The chocolate cake is amazing! I don't normally eat the cream that comes with cakes, but the lightness of the cream and the berries mixed in make every bite pure joy! It's not too sweet and you don't feel guilty after eating a whole cake as it's not super rich and dense. The ladies at the shop are friendly as well. Worth every penny.
author: Sherrie P.

description:
My coworker neighbor, whom my other coworkers and I bought a cake for her birthday, had one word to describe the cake:

"Orgasmic!"

While I wholeheartedly agree with this sentiment, I'll expand on this review now that I have stepped into this store a total of 10 times in about 3 weeks, which is 9 times more than at any other bakery I've visited to this day. And now that I have had the opportunity to try two different flavored cakes, I have a better review to give. 

First story: I came in this store three weeks ago (after previously stopping in front of this facility several times) to try a slice of the green tea cake ($6). One thing that stood out was how light the cake was, which I favor because that's what I grew up on for every birthday. The flavor was very subtle, and contrary to what some people have noted, it wasn't dry at all. After asking the sweet girl at the counter about the different types of Asian-like light cakes and getting them sufficiently answered, I made the decision to come back soon.

Second story: This past Monday after work, I came into this store and asked Sonya for an 8" Very Berry Blueberry cake ($45), initially for Thursday for my coworker's birthday. However, upon finding out the day before that she would be off on her actual birthday, I rushed over to the store the next day in low-key panic mode to ask Sonya if she could have it ready by this morning (Wednesday). Rather than refuse me on the spot or even charging me a rush fee, she told me that she would have it ready by 11am today. 

And sure enough, at 11:25 the sweet girl (note to self: GET HER NAME) called me saying that the cake was ready! 

Thank you Sonya for coming through when I needed it. 
And while I promised you that I wouldn't be coming back again...I just want to say that I lied.

I'll probably be back next week, if not sooner. LOL!
author: Viet N.

description:
This is my third time getting a cake from them. They are located close to my office so for convenience, we started ordering cakes from here earlier this year. This first cake was the blueberry. Everyone liked it, so we decided to order from them for upcoming birthdays in the office. The second cake we bought was the chocolate cake with the raspberry. It was just meh. The cake itself was dry and the cream had a little bit of a weird texture to it as if it wasn't fresh. We still decided to give them another chance because it could have been an off day.
Well, the third order is what prompted me to leave this review.
I called on a Wednesday to order the strawberry vanilla cake for pickup on Friday - our office only celebrates birthdays on Fridays. On Thursday, a lady called from the store saying that they've been waiting all day for me to come pick it up. I informed them that it was to be picked up on Friday and not Thursday. She said my mistake I'll see you tomorrow. After I hung up I had this gut feeling that I should have called them back to make sure that they'd be making a fresh cake for me on Friday,but I didn't call because I expected that they definitely would not want to give me a day old sponge cake. 
Well, lo and behold, I arrive on Friday to pick up the cake and I could immediately tell this was the day old cake, so I asked the lady (I think it might have been the owner) if it was the same cake they made the day before and she said yes it was. I asked her why they didn't make a new cake for me and the lady said that they typically make the cakes the day before for all pre orders and that it was better for the cake to sit for a whole day for the cream to set... Now i'm not a baker, but this sounded a bit sketchy and lazy to me. 
I noticed some of the strawberries on the outside of the cake were rotting and browning. I pointed it out to her as I do want to bring back a cake with rotten fruit to the office. She told me that they have some quality issues with their fruits because they are organic... hmmm, I believe it was because she just left the cake refrigerated all day Thursday and Friday and organic fruit doesn't hold up well. She exchanged the two rotting strawberries with new ones and gave me the same cake. I took the cake because I had no other choice, but this didn't sit well with me at all. I googled about sponge cakes and it turns out they are to be sold fresh, not a day old, and that they are not to be stored in any regular refrigerator if you want it to stay tasting fresh.
I am very very disappointing with how they handled this situation, especially for a place this pricey. They proudly serve day old cakes for people who pre-order and expect a fresh cake baked that morning. If she bakes the cake a day before, that would mean they sold me cake that was baked on Wednesday. Expensive places should deliver better quality and service!
TSK TSK.
author: Mamie S.

description:
Haven't even taken a bite yet.

Strike 1.  $33 dollars for a 6 inch cake.  Shame on me.

Strike 2.  Asked them to write happy birthday but they don't do that for 6 inch cakes.  Wow.

Strike 3.  Asked for a bag.  Paid 25 cents.  Fine.  But she just hands me the folded back.  Can't even help or offer to put the cake into the bag.  Nope.  

Hope it tastes 6 inch 33 dollar good....
author: Gary Z.

description:
first - their location is super close, so that was my workaround to their $100 delivery fee. 
second- selection is limited. YOU may think they are in the business of selling their pretty cakes to walk-in customers, but the fact is, you need upwards of 48 hours for anything over 6". So all the pretty cakes you see... nah... not for you.
third- the words used exactly were " we need 24 hours to write a script on a cake"  ohhhh ... let me get this straight- you just sell WHOLE CAKES ( i get it ) and maybe slices, i saw slices too... but to write a simple Happy Birthday ( i would forgo even getting specific with a name ) 24 hour notice.
fourth- I wasn't that thrilled on the $33 for a tiny 6" cake. but ok- bit of a bind and didn't want cupcakes.
fifth- I suspect that I will not go back and continue to walk past as I usually do. When I walked in there were four people behind their tiny counter - all of them looked up and then went back to what they were doing. I wont get into the possible reasons why, however, like I said, i'll just continue to walk by. 
Best of luck cake searchers of the soma area.
author: Tiffany H.

description: I liked their cakes a lot initially. Loved the fresh creme. Been a customer for several years. There were a few times that the cake itself was too dense to a point we thought it didn't cook through. I called to complain but didn't receive any apologies. I didn't bother to bring it back as I had no faith in their customer service. And this time they really lost me as customer. Because I called Friday morning to pick up a cake that's available, I requested them to write a happy birthday sign on it. The girl who picked up the phone just told me no and refused to check with the chef. I knew the chef is always in the store. It would only take her a min to write the letters in jam. She did it before, several times. But they just couldn't do it and the answer was without empathy. I'm not entiredly mad because of the no. It's more because I'm sad they made ZERO connection with their loyal customer. I will no longer be a customer nor my friends .
author: S S.

description: I love Sonya and Whole Cakes! Best cake in all of SF. Light and delicious. Everyone in the party asked about the cake!
author: Rima M.

description: Beautifully presented and delicious cakes and cookies.  Mille crepe cake is light, tasty and not super-sweet.  Great place to explore unadulterated versions of classics and some new flavor combos, too.
author: Darryl C.

description:
I was more than happy to support a local business like Whole Cakes, but unfortunately was left with a sour taste in my mouth after my visits.

I went in one morning for just a cup of coffee. The service was not overly friendly and the coffee tasted a bit bitter.

I went in a second time and figured I should try one of their baked goods, as that seems to be what they are known for. I went in around 7:40 a.m. on a weekday, which doesn't seem super early to me; however, they had very few baked goods to choose from. I tried some sort of citrus pistachio cupcake that was $3.50. I literally ate the whole thing in 1 bite. It was more like an extremely expensive brownie bite compared to a large muffin. The flavor was OK, but the price and size was what disappointed me.

Additionally, their small menu states they have COLD BREW COFFEE; however, I waited for at least 5 minutes as the workers frantically searched for ice. They couldn't find ice, so they served me luke warm coffee with cold water added to it. Needless to say, it tasted gross. They offered to refund my money.

Perhaps I should go back in the afternoon to try some of their other things, but I wasn't too impressed with Whole Cakes.
author: John L.

description:
We love their cakes! I ordered a coconut pine apple cake for my husband's BD and everyone loved it!!!! The perfect amount of sweetness, fresh and designed with style!
Compliments on chef
author: Nasim K.

description: Very clean location with a beautiful display case. There is a chalk board on the wall, which lists the cake flavors and muffins of the day. I appreciate the price tags and description located in front of each cookie variety, but there were no price tags or flavors in front of the cakes or cake slices. I grabbed a printed menu, which listed the cake flavors and prices, but there was no price info for cake by the slice, so I was shocked when I picked one out for $6 a slice! I got the double chocolate raspberry, which was very light, but at the sticker price per slice I'm not interested in getting again. I would like to try the crepe cake, and I saw the staff building the crepe cake while I was there, stacking multiple thin crepe layers on top of each other. I would recommend the gluten free chocolate chip cookie, delicious, and I appreciate the vegan cookie option, but I will probably skip in the future.
author: Lisa H.

description: Cakes taste delicious, but you can get the same tasting cakes and a much larger cakes at WholeFoods for half the price. I guess if you can spend the extra cash on a delicious cake go for it, but it is a little bit to pricey. I appreciate the message of it being  100%organic, but when it's that expensive it excludes other people the opportunity to enjoy organic foods that should be a societal norm by now.
author: Tiffany A.

description:
A few times a year, I come here to pick up birthday cakes for my parents and family. We truly love Whole Cakes. They are delicious, not too sweet, and we always finish up the entire cake. 

So far the ones I've tried are:
1) Red Bean & Pistachio (so far my fav)
2) Green tea crepe cake
3) Sweet Potato

I'd like to thank the owner for taking my last minute cake order 24 hours before. I really appreciated it and so did my mom who loved her cake! Can't wait to try more flavors.
author: Laura Y.

description: A healthy way to get your sweet nutrition :) fresh berries and country style baked goods that aim to please. No artificial crap here. Made my thanksgiving dinner a blast!
author: James G.

description:
Wow so good. I binged on whole cakes for a couple of days in a row. And they are right, the cakes make you feel good, at least not as bad as eating the run of the mill cakes which make me break out, and cause havoc on my system. 

These cakes are cleaner and tastier.

Try 'em!
author: Emma T.

description: I love the different flavors that you can get here. I like their cookies. Their cakes are overpriced I find but I guess that's no different from the rest of the SF bakeries. Overall a good afternoon treat to self place in the Fidi area.
author: Aaron T.

description:
Sonya created the perfect cake for my friend's baby shower. The cake was the perfect mix of texture and taste - dense, moist, and not too sweet - and design. I came into the bakery knowing exactly what flavor of cake that I wanted, but was having a hard time coming up with a design. Per Sonya's suggestion, I showed her a copy of the shower invitation and she recreated it perfectly. 
Needless to say, the cake was a hit. I would definitely order another cake from Sonya.
author: Jeanine G.

description:
The cake is overpriced for what it is. I believe that more experienced chefs charge less for their cakes. The ingredients are good and the flavor is ok, but overall not up expectations. I also didn't like the muffin I tried. Because I live in San Francisco I taste great muffins and such all over town. This wasn't one of them. I won't be back.

Update to my review:
The reason I wasn't very happy is because the cake was mostly whipped cream. It wasn't worth the $40 or whatever I paid for a small cake. I made a joke to my mom that they don't like to use their oven because it's too polluting to the air to breathe, because there was literally almost no cake. At least 3/4 of the whole thing was whipped cream. And i said, but oh they love their mixer. (whipped cream)
author: Michele P.

description:
I am a bit surprised at all positive comments about this place so in all fairness I would give them a chance again.  I also noticed a negative comment about their Strawberry Vanilla Cake which basically was what I tried at this place.  Price was reasonable but the cake was dense and dry- thick layers of whipped cream with fresh strawberry.  I like my pastry low in sugar and the level of sweetness was exactly how I prefer. 

I give them 2 stars- one for getting the amount of sugar right and one for nice box!!! 


Will go there again- to see what the hype is all about but they need to revise their Strawberry Vanilla recipe.
author: Megan K.

description:
Breakfast: De la Paz coffee and blueberry muffin. 

Blueberry muffin is moist, crumbly, not too sweet. 

Coffee: love De La Paz! Granted my coffee tastes don't align with the average SF coffee snob but this stuff is perfect. $2 for 12 oz not bad!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Whole cakes despite its name sells slices of cake along with whole cakes. They also have coffee and tea.

== Food == 

Almond Honey Cake sounded very delicious to me so I bought one before I saw the cake was gluten free. I had pitchforks out and was ready to make stink faces at the cake. However, after my first bite... it tasted really good! The texture was like a brand muffin, but the taste made up for it.

== Overall ==

Expensive for a slice of cake, but the quality and taste is high.
author: Steven B.

description: Cakes are great, but if your planning to have the cake when they say it will be ready, don't count on it.
author: k w.

description: Primo cookies.  Nice staff.  Small store w/big punch.
author: Alf O.

description:
Popped by for a slice of green tea cake ($6) after meeting a friend for lunch last week. The flavor on the cake was nice but I thought it was a little dry. People here are super nice and the cakes look cute. There's a small counter at the front window where you can eat but it looked like most people were getting stuff to go back to the office. 

Lesson for me - since I have no guilt about desserts I should probably avoid healthy ones because I probably won't like them. Maybe if you want a healthy cake this would be a good choice.
author: Jean K.

description: Whole Cakes totally saved my life for an event I was staffing. Someone put me in charge of getting a small birthday cake for one of our speakers, and most of the places around Financial District were either too pricey, too large, or would not accommodate last minute orders. Everyone who works at Whole Cakes made the process of ordering super easy, and I could not be more grateful about the quality of the cake in the amount of time it took to get it. I believe I ordered it the morning of the event and was able to pick it up right before closing time. The cake was gorgeous and perfectly sized, and everyone who works there was super friendly when I walked in. Definitely ordering more from Whole Cakes in the future!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Walk past it everyday. Nice little place. Finally walked in and It took so long before someone can answer my questions. All I wanted to know is what are the ingredients? Food allergies issues.
Cash only? What? The pastries and cookies or something was just piled up. 
Ughh, not a nice presentation. I think I will keep
author: K C.

description:
I work for Charles Schwab and we were in the process of setting up an event for one of our directors. I "stumbled" upon this place and by the reviews and the pictures, I had a feeling this would be the best place to order a cake. 

When I went to the website I was surprised by the choices. Sweet potato? Green tea? Red bean?! That's paradise right there! So unique and so amazing. 

Anywho, I ordered the sweet potato because I wanted to be adventurous and .... I just really wanted to try it and I also ordered the double chocolate (sub strawberries). 

Sonya is so kind and genuine! When I asked if we could sub strawberries instead of raspberries she was happy to do so! Throughout the whole process, Sonya was always there - and by that I mean I knew I could email her and she would reply ASAP. 

Finally when the day arrived, Sonya called and updated me on an eta and she got to my work so fast.. I was really surprised! I was also very pleased that she delivered the cake herself. 

The cakes - wow. Just wow. Everyone was speechless of how amazing the cakes were. Not too sweet and not heavy, it was moist and honestly.. Those were the best cakes I've ever had in my life. So many people afterwards asked me where I got the cake, so expect a lot more customers!! 

One main thing that you can tell immediately upon meeting Sonya and opening the cakes is that she takes pride in her work. She puts love and so much compassion into it and yet, very humble. I don't know anyone who would deliver their own cake and work so closely with customers the way she did. Thanks again, Sonya! You're awesome.
author: Gabrielle M.

description: My husband and I ordered our wedding cake from Whole Cakes and we could not have been more pleased. We were looking for a cake that was beautiful, but not overly sweet as many cakes can be. Sonya was so accommodating and incorporated our ideas perfectly. The price was very reasonable and tasted so fresh when we took our first bites. We had each layer of our cake a different flavor. I think my favorite was the blueberry. It is so moist and filled with blueberry flavor in every bite. Everyone at our wedding loved their cake! I can't wait to go back for more!
author: Karen K.

description:
Where to begin?

1. There are photos of cupcakes online, yet you cannot order them online. When I called to order via telephone, Dennis couldn't even tell me what flavors were available. In the photo, I saw a blueberry one, yet he insisted that wasn't a flavor they offered. 

2. No delivery fee included in the online order form, even though delivery is specified as the only option.

3. Every time I called to ask a question, and referenced my order number, no one knew what I was referring to. 

4. I'm grateful for all the flexibility they showed when we had to postpone the event we ordered a cake for, however, after phone calls with two different employees to confirm the new delivery date, they still didn't have the correct info.

In short, we had to go pick it up ourselves, and when speaking to Dennis on the phone to inquire about our delivery, he was very rude, questioning whether or not we could even pay the $10 delivery fee. 

Upon entering the bakery to pick to up our cake, we were also treated with disrespect. We tried to talk about our frustrations, but everyone just stood there and looked at each other with nothing to say. 

Clearly we won't be back.
author: Bridgette L.

description: I ordered a 10" strawberry cream birthday cake for a friend here and I'm going to start off by saying $70 for a mediocre tasting 10" cake is pretty absurd. I also requested that some hand-lettering be added to the top of the dessert and I assumed that the high price included the decoration cost (silly me). It turns out that the cake alone was $70 and they didn't charge me for the decorating because it was "so simple." I'm glad I didn't pay for the customization because the incomplete lettering looked as though an elementary school student had done it. The cake itself was slightly dry and although the fresh strawberry filling and frosting were tasty, I just think I grossly overpaid for what I received. This place is also closed on weekends which is kind of a bummer.
author: Sasha A.

description: Cake is light, not cloyingly sweet and very fresh! We had the double chocolate for our friend's birthday and everyone raved about it. Will come back again for an afternoon tea next time =)
author: Kathy Z.

description:
I found this business solely based on search and yelp! I was not let down :). I ordered a cake a few days before my daughter's birthday party and there were no problems with the order.  The owner communicated some options beforehand by email. This is a well run business who hires top notch employees. They took down my information, the cake details, and the birthday girl's name. I never had to call to check on it, it was ready for pickup at the stated time and most importantly, the cake was MOIST AND DELICIOUS!!!  As a plus, the ingredients are locally sourced and organic!

Definitely coming back here for all my dessert needs!
author: Elena R.

description:
Looking for a cake delivery place in San Francisco? 
Look no further!! Whole Cakes is truly your smartest choice.

Here are the reasons why:
1. The Coffee Lover's Mocha cake I got for my grand aunt was heavenly delicious (AND HEALTHY). Not too sweet, and so airy. Din't have those layers of icing compared to other traditional excessively sweet american cakes.
2. I am VERY satisfied with the customer service, so did all other people.
The owner, Sonya, was very sweet and thoughtful.
3. Can deliver on weekend !!!!!!!!! (big plus)
4. Cakes are made with all organic and natural ingredients, and can still be delicious. (gigantic plus)

I am so satisfied with my experience and so pumped to share it with all my fellow yelpers:

Being days away from Mother's Day, I was in need to look for a surprise gift for my grand aunt, however, I didn't want to rush to pick something she wouldn't like.
Trying to do research on what bakery delivers  while I am in another city was time consuming and frustrating all at the same time. 
Thank godness that I stumbled upon Whole Cakes!!

Given my grand aunt's age, I was sold to order from Sonya when I read about her mission to create healthy desserts. I went for Coffee Lover's Mocha since coffee is my aunt's favorite flavor.

Not too long after I placed my order online, Sonya sent me a confirmation email with order detail, and asked me if there's any further modification (add message, add inscription, etc).
The day of my scheduled delivery, she sent me an email along with the photo of the actual cake before she send it out. What a pleasant surprise!
Sonya also included a note card with my message along with the cake.

My grand aunt was a happy camper that day, but the cake didn't get to last too long, it was THAT GOOD.

The over all experience was awesome. I will definitely order cakes from Sonya again! Highly recommend!

Delicious + healthy cake, spot on customer service......
What is not to love?
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I ordered the double chocolate, crepe, green tea, and strawberry and cream cake for the March babies at my office. And here I am again ordering for the May babies.
