Chocolate: I didn't try this, because I am not a chocolate cake fan. However, everyone that did said it was delicious.

Strawberry and cream: My second favorite out of the bunch I ordered. The cream was light, the cake was fluffy, and the strawberries were sweet. I ate 3 pieces and didn't feel like a cow. 

Green tea: My favorite, and it will be yours too if you like matcha. I was scared it would be overpowering, but it was just the perfect, subtle hint of flavor. 

Crepe: Although it didn't taste bad, I just wasn't a fan of the texture. It seemed soggy although I'm sure that's just how crepe cakes are. 

All in all, the cakes were delicious. It's a yummy alternative to cakes that may have tons of sugar and make you feel sick afterwards (although I like those too lol).
author: Abby B.

description: OMG the crepe layer cake. SO GOOD. Everything at this shop looked good but we were so intrigued by the crepe cake. The prices were pretty standard for a luxury bakery. Friendly service too!
author: Julia M.

description:
They has "some" good stuff here but the 1 star is for customer service.
Went into Whole Cakes on Mission in San Francisco a few months ago and had a piece of the chocolate cake and loved it! I have a birthday event for 10 this weekend so thought I would wow my party with this wonderful chocolate cake. I called to order and asked if they have the same cake as the pieces that they sell and they said yes they do how many people? I answered 10 people so she said I will need an 8 inch round which they do happen to have. I asked again..this is the same cake as the one that you sell the slices of. Yes. Go to pick up the cake that afternoon and am surprised that the height of the cake is half the size.I say is this the cake? She says yes.. I say its so short..she says well.."We make a larger cake (which is really just a normal sized cake) for the slices because we charge 6.00 per slice"? Ok...I'm thinking..I'm paying 50.00 for half the cake that I thought I was. So I pay (my bad as I should have said forget it) and go on my way. Looking at the cake when I get it home and it just kind of bothers me..Yes, it is the same cake but not a normal size cake.So, I call this morning just to tell them that I really didnt think this was right and suggest that they inform people in the future but never got a chance. She was so argumentative from the get go that I never even got to finish my point..It does make a HUGE difference, especially for a special event. All she wanted to do was argue the point that "it is the same cake". Hmm..not really...
I finally hung up because this woman does not know how to listen. She calls me back to tell me that she wants to do the fair thing which was to make an 8 inch full size cake sometime next week and then I should come in to see her to compare the size. REALLY?? Shall I save a piece of my already too small cake to bring with me to get an accurate comparison?.
How is that being fair? She says well.."You said it doesnt taste the same! I say..well if you were really listening you would know that I never said any such thing. The cake is still sitting in my refrigerator because the event is not until tonight so I have not touched it! More arguing..I finally hung up again. Wowie, zowie! Done with this place. I will never step foot in there again. All I was trying to do was give them some good business advice. From now on when somebody orders a chocolate cake or any other cake that is only half the height of the slices they sell they should let them know beforehand.. So, I recieved "half" the cake that I thought I was getting and paying for AND it is not enough for party of 10. I now have to go buy something else. Anybody who wants chocolate cake you should buy the slices..otherwise you will get a very tiny short piece and I'm kinda guessing they wont be as good because I dont believe you can get the same taste out of a 3 inch cake!!! Well see
author: Kathleen G.

description:
TL;DR Staff here treat people differently based on appearance.

Note: This a review purely based on their customer service. I have not tried their food and quite frankly do not plan to. 

Context: I desperately needed to buy a birthday cake by the end of the day and saw on yelp that this place was close by. I stopped by during the afternoon. (I myself am a short teenager who had my backpack with me).

I walked inside and was quickly greeted with a simple "Hi"--great. There were two people behind the counter (the cake chef herself who was frosting some cakes and a cashier person doing some stuff in the back). I looked around and realized that the cakes were smaller than they looked on their website. There were a couple 6" cakes lying around in the counter--some frosted, some not. I asked the chef if I had to order cakes in advance and whether a cake could be made by the end of the day if I ordered one at that very second. She stopped what she was doing and gave me the "up and down" look and very sharply replied "No. We carry some of most popular cakes for walk-ins. People have to order 2 days in advance." Her attitude and tone was very unpleasant and I felt quite uncomfortable--okay, I really need to get a cake so I'll just get one of the small cakes they have on shelf. They kept their eyes on me as I looked through the glass counter. 

A couple seconds later, an adult couple in their twenties walk in. The chef and the other staff's  attention quickly turn towards them. The staff greeted them very politely and asked if they needed any assistance. Both the staff made chit chat with the couple and described to them all the goodies they had. I was left alone, just hanging out behind the counter looking at cakes by myself. No ugly stare was given to the couple and the attitude and tone of voice of the staff changed from snarky to super friendly and nice. 

WHAT?!?! Their customer service changed completely within the course of less than a minute. After the couple left, I was still by myself just looking at cakes. The cashier person then asks "Are you going to get anything?" very abruptly. DID SHE JUST SAY THAT TO ME? Flabbergasted, I walk out of there hearing some faint remarks about me as leave the bakery. 

I am in disbelief about how they treated me compared to their other customers. Would not recommend this place to anyone (even if their cakes are out of this world).
author: Anna H.

description:
If you are organic freak and looking for some good coffee this is a perfect stop in downtown San Francisco. 

The prices are fair and their service is epic. With over a dozen varieties of snacks to choose from you won't be disappointed what ever you pick.

The cookies are as fresh as they can be. The cookies n cakes are baked fresh and right in front of us. their ingredients are all organic and they have a choice of vegan too. 

Loved their coffee and almond cookies.
author: naga madan c.

description:
$30 for a 6" cake is a great price - especially since this place uses real, all natural ingredients. We got the double chocolate cake with raspberry filling. It was incredible! 

Very light and airy yet still flavorful. My family isn't a fan of the overly sweet cakes, so this was perfect. 

Their customer service is also great. I totally forgot about the cake because I was so busy with hosting my whole family in town. They called me Friday evening and stayed open an extra twenty minutes until my boyfriend could get there. I will definitely be back!
author: Erica C.

description: Bought one of each slice of their cake today...I was excited to try it all as soon as I got home. Very disappointed...it's has all the right fluffiness airiness and texture...but definitely need a sweetness to it. It's very bland.
author: Cheryl C.

description:
Amazing is the word!!!! 
I went in there a week ago on Friday afternoon, hoping to pick up a birthday cake for my husband's birthday. They only had one cake in the size i wanted and that was not the kind of flavor i was hoping for. I had read great reviews and had planned the whole birthday in my mind, from flowers, to cake to dinner in my head that when I saw that they didn't have any other options that i'd like, available -  I just stood there dejected and sad. Like really sad with a sad face. ( I know, over-dramatic!) 
And I think they realized that too, the sweet sweet girl behind the counter asked me if I could come back an hour later, I asked why? She said, she bake one for me!!!! Imagine that!

She asked me what kind of a cake did I want - I said chocolate and berries. She said sure. And Finicky that I am, I asked to ensure she didn't put any black or Raspberries in there. She said sure! I was still kinda wary if she'd be able to do that in an hour or not. I told her to make sure it was ready in that hour since I had to catcha bus home. Not a problem, she said! An hour later, I went back in. And lo and Behold! The perfect Cake I wanted for my hubby dearest!  
He loved it, said, it was one of the best cakes, he'd eaten in a while! And the fact that it was specially baked for him!  The taste was perfect, the decoration - impeccable like their other cakes!

But what bowled me over, was the fact that she saw that look on my face and told me she'd bake a cake and get it ready for me - even when she didn't have to!!

Girl, you've got a customer for life now!!
author: Twinkle T.

description: This is cake for people who like light fluffy cakes that aren't overwhelmingly sweet or rich. In that way, it's very compatible with some Asian palates. I like getting the slice of chocolate cake that has raspberries and whipped cream ($5). It's a little bit like a black forest cake. I've also gotten a whole cake for my friend's birthday. They always keep a few around so you can just walk in and buy a whole cake without pre ordering. However, if you want a particular cake and a name written on it, you have to order at least 24 hours in advance. A friend also ordered cupcakes from here for her birthday and they were amazing. The frosting was not buttercream, but not whipped cream either. It was somehow lighter than buttercream (which can be a little heavy because it's just butter and sugar), but had more body and depth than whipped cream. The quality of these cakes is very high and the rent must be high as well, so expect to pay accordingly.
author: Cat M.

description:
Just got one slice of cake for my husband's bday since he doesn't like sweets...

I thought all the cakes were nicely decorated (none of that overly designed cheap looking cakes) and the one I bought tasted great.  Not too sweet.  Very sophisticated. 

I want to come back to this place again.
author: EriCardo F.

description: Write a simple happy birthday on your $35 small cake? Not. If you want that go down the street and buy a frosting writer to do it yourself.
author: Michael O.

description: Mouthfuls of deliciousness! Had my first Whole Cake just yesterday and I'll for sure be a regular here. Can't wait to try another!
author: Nayeli M.

description: Bought the special pumpkin cake and it was a hit! I really like how there's not too much of a sweet taste and the whip cream is Delish. Presentation was lovely and I will definitely be back!
author: Mishi S.

description:
The gluten free carrot cake is delicious. I'm extremely picky with what I eat so finding this place was perfect. I had been dreaming of a muffin the whole day and then suddenly there it was. 

And the owner was very helpful with explaining what ingredients was in it without being annoyed. 

The price is a bit high though. A small muffin costs 3 dollar but it was worth it. I wouldn't go here every day but when I deserve a little extra this would def be the spot. 

Unfortunately I live in Sweden and I would love to see more places like this so please franchise it! :)
author: Samira M.

description:
Excellent cake. Came here to get a birthday cake on short notice and the owners were very accommodating. They prepared the final touches on the cake in only a few hours.
Had the black sesame and red bean 6" cake. It was fantastic - not the kind of sugar-packed, diabetes-inducing cake you usually get. It was not too sweet, which allowed the real flavour of the cake emerge. The focus wasn't sugar, but the light fluffiness of the cream and cake. Like buttery air!
Absolutely would recommend to anyone not of the sugar-overload dessert persuasion!
author: Sarah J.

description:
Best muffin ever. 

I have enjoyed many a muffin over the course of my lifetime, though the overall quality has deteriorated significantly as I have ascribed to gluten freedom. Yesterday, on my walk to work, I saw Whole Cakes and decided to pop in and give their gluten free muffins a try. It was some combination of zucchini and citrus and was moist, flavorful and perfect. 

While the muffins were a little on the small side for the price I don't care, I will go back for another.
author: Vanessa G.

description: Sonya was super helpful and friendly, and the cakes was really yummy!!  Everyone loved it!  Highly recommend it!
author: Elena L.

description: My partner ordered matcha cake with fresh strawberries (and asked for less sweet frosting) for my birthday. I think it was probably the best cake I've had in the recent years. The cake was soft, very fluffy, moist, and not overly sweet. It reminded me of cakes we have in Korea/Japan!
author: Christina C.

description:
After spending days on the Yelp pages of various cake shops around the city, I decided to go with Sonya's Whole Cakes for a friend's birthday dinner. I ended up choosing the double chocolate topped with raspberries, which was as beautiful and delectable as it sounds! (I'll try to upload a pic later)

Even though the group had made their way through two hefty desserts (creme brulee and berry crumble) before the cake arrived at the table, it was a hit! I loved the light texture of the cake - it didn't feel heavy at all despite the fact that it was a DOUBLE chocolate cake, but it still retained its chocolate-y creamy goodness. Also, did I mention the ingredients are organic? Definitely a cherry on top of the icing.

I can't wait to go back and try the coffee lover's cake and Sonya's new crepe layer cake! She also just opened a store on First and Mission, which is 3 blocks away from where I live.. bye bye waist line.
author: Laura Y.

description:
I interned in the financial district over summer and almost came here everyday for sweets and coffee. Their gluten free muffins are my favorite! I ate at least two a day for three weeks straight. 

I've also had their cookies. My favorite is the real grey and this other cookie made from almond flour.

The cakes are interesting flavors and similar to the Asian style bakeries in southern California. The Feb tea cake was so good!

What I love about this place is that the desserts aren't overly sweet and the flavors are so unique and different.

Also love the owners :) they made me feel at home in the city and always let me come in to get some muffins right before they close or open. They're super sweet and nice!
author: Tracy V.

description:
One of the best cakes I've had in a long long time. Sonya was a delight to work with and made sure that she made the perfect cake to suit my needs. I ordered a Green Tea -Mango cake and it was just perfect!! 

I found it to be a little on the pricier side.. But definitely worth it if you are celebrating something special!
author: Balasubramanian R.

description: I have been enjoying their cakes since they opened. Such a welcome addition to the neighborhood and an easy way to pick up a birthday treat for friends and family right after work. Today I got three cookies to share with my family and they were so good I ate them all, in one sitting, oops!
author: Carolina M.

description:
They were out of the 6 inch round cakes when I stopped in to pick up a cake for my husband's birthday.However, the owner was nice enough to make me one but suggested that I come back in 20 minutes. I thought it was really nice of her to offer to make me one, and told her I would be back around 3 p.m. instead to pick it up. 
Showed up at 3 p.m. only to find out that the cake was not made yet. She offered to deliver it to my office. Although, I was a little bummed about the cake not being ready when I arrived to pick it up,
I liked that she went out of her way to fix the issues we ran into. 
The cake was really tasty. It was loaded with whipped crème, which I liked. I only wished that it was a bit sweeter.
author: Chan S.

description: These guys (and ladies and kids) are the best! They get the best coffee (de la paz) on the block, play soothing jazz music and bake the most deliciously bomb desserts every salad-eating techy hipster will pass up to avoid the calories. Just go in, look, smile, smell! Enjoy!
author: Liz S.

description:
Found this place on Yelp and decided to get the cake for my bf.  

I emailed to the shop to ask if they have smaller size than 6 inches. They replied my email so fast and said they habe 4 inches but better to pre order it  

The next day I went to the shop and order a 4 inches green tea with fresh strawberry cake.  The shop was very clean.  The staffs were very friendly and helpful. 

The next day I went to pick up the cake around 1:40pm.  Unfortunately the cake was not ready yet (supposed to pick up at 2pm)....They told me they were still making it.  Oh well, I came back later and I was so happy.  The cake does look very cute and pretty.  But I rememeber I requested to have strawberries instead of mango....my mistake?!?

Anyway, the cake was very good.  Very moist and light.  You definitely love it when you don't like too sweet.  The portion is prefect for 2 to 3 people.  

I would definitely go back to order one....For myself later!
author: Liza T.

description:
Update long overdue! (What happened to my previous one? Anyway I am a FAN of Whole Cakes - serious fan)

We ordered a coffee birthday cake for my brother in law. Omg it was delicious and of course everyone raved and asked where it was from. I love Whole Cakes. It's a refreshing change from all the heavy dense overly sweet and boring cakes out there. These treats are light and delicate while delivering serious flavors. Yum. And your body will thank you for it. ;-)
author: Jessica H.

description:
I first tried their double chocolate raspberry cake at an office birthday party for a co-worker. It was light and delightful, so when my brother's bday party came up soon after I decided to order the same cake. My brother is super health conscious so I figured the less sugary/heavy cake would be a good option for him too. 

The owner of the bakery is super sweet and very helpful. I asked her for the larger cake, but upon hearing that there would be 10-15 guests she suggested I go with the smaller (cheaper) cake--proving that she is not out to make a buck.

The cake was a huge hit!! The birthday dinner had about 12 guests and every single person loved the cake--they were amazed at its airy taste and texture. The chocolate was perfect and fresh raspberries a great combination. It's not the heavy, sugary cakes you are used so if you're looking for a birthday cake like that, this is not the place for you (maybe Safeway?). 

The bakery itself is new, very clean and cute. I definitely want to try more of their desserts and plan on going back soon.
author: Maliha Z.

description: Best organic, mousse cakes ever. A bit expensive but you get what you pay for. My favorite is the chocolate with strawberries. They also have vegan and gluten free cookies.
author: Maria T.

description: This review is for their ginger molasses cookie.  My friend said their cakes are yummy so you'd think their other baked goods would be great, too.  I bought a ginger molasses cookie for $2 and couldn't wait to eat it.  I don't know about you but for me cookies should be soft with a little crunch on the outside.  This was not the case.  It was all crunch like it was over baked.  Ruined my morning.
author: Jen C.

description:
A bit hard to find, but a true gem. The place is a mom and pop shop with homemade cakes that are "healthy" (or healthier than your standard cakes), and moist! The frosting is also really, really good. They also make specialty cakes, which I totally want to try! (Green tea!? Sweet potato?! Red chai?!). They also make "standard" cakes like chocolate raspberry (yummm), strawberry, and vanilla.

The service was awesome and when I got my cake delivered, I was greeted by a haggle of kids as well since the dad was toting them around from one after school program to another. A really cute and family friendly business :).
author: Christina C.

description:
I came out of Yelp retirement to write this review because these are great people, and the cakes, muffins, and cookies are great.  So far I have had the coco-nib banana muffin, the cheesecake, the oatmeal choco cookie (I am butchering this), and the strawberry shortcake.  Muffins change often.

I first came in a few days after they first opened to get a coffee after Special Xtra had closed.  I have returned here almost daily since.

For those around 1st and Mission, this is a great place to buy your coffee in the morning.  The service is friendly, and De La Paz Coffee is smooth.  They give both a single cup drip option and a pour coffee option.  Both utilize different beans, and having had both, I have recommended them to others.  There is no option for espresso because Starbucks has a moratorium on espresso based drinks within a block - if you want those you have to go to Special Xtra (which I still frequent),  That said, I try to come here as much as I can - because we need good options for downtown, everything has been great, and I want this place to succeed.

Last, for those of you who are looking for a birthday cake for your co-worker or boss, this is the best option I have found.  I have had cakes from every shop in the vicinity - Tart to Tart, Cafe Madeleine, Miette, and Anderson Bakery.  This is by far the best I have had around here - not too sweet and made with great ingredients.  An added plus for the Financial District - they are reasonably priced.
author: Kapeli M.

description:
I discovered this place on Yelp and I am so incredibly impressed!! Sonya was super sweet and the cake was out of this world. I got one of their chocolate cakes, which had a very unique taste(with a hint of tea flavor perhaps?). It was unforgettable. 

They also sell vegan cookies and gluten free muffins!! I tried the vegan earl grey shortbread cookie and cannot believe it had no butter in it. I will be coming back...probably more often than I should!
author: Angelina M.

description:
I love supporting small mom & pop's cafe, restaurant, etc. This place is a little gem situated in FiDi and a few doors down from Starbucks off of Mission and 1st St.  next to a parking structure.  

I came in around 4:00 pm and was surprisingly greeted by a little girl taking my order.  I ordered the slow drip coffee ($3)  and a blueberry crepe layered cake ($6) since I saw so many 5 star reviews so I must give in. I was not disappointed at all. 

My slow drip coffee was strong and you can actually taste the espresso. I added a little organic half & half and sugar to lighten up the bold favor. It was absolutely delish! Just how my coffee taste bud likes it. 

The blueberry layered cake was also pleasantly delicious. Not too sweet and the crepes are thinly layered between what I think is a blueberry mousse. 

Overall, I was love this place and I would definitely go back and try all their other cakes. I like how it's small and conveniently located (couple blocks down from work).
author: Lynnda T.

description:
I work too close...way too close.  I have gone everyday for a cookie or a slice of cake and NOTHING has disappointed.  Sonya and her family are warm and welcoming.  But what is more amazing than their openness is her selection of delightful goodies.  The strawberry cream is so light and fresh.  The mango tango is simply tasty...i could have eaten the whole cake.  The chocolate is light, airy yet tasty of chocolate.  
Her morning muffins are oh my gosh good. 
Her cookies...holy crap.  the 3 spice, the gluten free chocolate chip and the wheat germ - i cannot decide...so i eat one of each.  
go...and enjoy.  you will not regret it.
author: Sonia C.

description: Horrible experience with the customer service ended up ruining my daughter's first birthday cake!
author: Manjiri M.

description: i LOVE this place. work nearby, which is always dangerous. basically, if you're looking for a simple traditional cake and a cheap price, this isn't probably the place for you. But if you care about quality ingredients and freshness you can taste this is seriously some of the best cake I've had (triple citrus cake is amazing). Also, of note, they have the BEST gluten free muffins I have ever had. I have no idea how they make it so fluffy?! Really, especially if you're GF - stop by just to try their muffin. It's a bit pricey ($4 for a muffin) but if you're GF and been missing delicious, moist, fluffy baked goods it is TOTALLY worth it!
author: Rebekah H.

description: I like this place so far after one visit.  I need a last minute dessert for party.  There were five of us so I was planning to pick up a small whole cake.  I stopped by after work and it was close to the end of their business hour.  The two ladies working there were still very busy decorating cakes.  All their cakes on display has been reserved. They were making more so they asked if I can wait for an hour, that would be after their business hour stated on the door.  I think it is nice that they still can finish an order even after they are supposed to close.  I could not wait at the time so I decided to go for the slices.  I had very berry blueberry cake.  It is moist and with light flavor.  I am not a big fan of sugary taste in a cake and this cake is just perfect to me.  I also tried the layered crepe cake.  I like the first few bites but it is a bit too dense for my taste.  My friends like the layered cake though.  They also told me that the online order with in-store pick-up needs to be reserved two days prior.
author: Jiayin L.

description:
OUTSTANDING Cake!

I ordered a cake for my Fiance's birthday. It was a last minute order. Henry was very nice and helpful, he took my call after the store closed and helped me coordinate and execute this elaborate plan. He changed the raspberry filling for strawberry and was willing to drop the cake off earlier than the store hours to accommodate my request. Most importantly the cake was divine. It was light and delicious and I highly recommend it. I ordered the double chocolate with a strawberry filling instead of the raspberry. 

I can't wait to try the other flavors. Thanks Henry!
author: Salma B.

description: I live nearby and noticed this location opened up fairly recently. Every time i come in, its not like they have bunch of cakes pre made, the impression i got is that its more about you call in ahead and have it ready to be picked up. They'll have cupcakes or couple of whole cakes made though. When i came in the staff was very nice and friendly. I wanted to pick up a whole cake but they didn't have any but the lady was super nice and told me that she could have it ready 15-20 mins. Which is not a long time and the best thing is that it would be freshly made. I got bunch of cupcakes instead, and yea they were very delicious!!! All my girlfriend thought so too. :)
author: Anudari K.

description: Disappointed with matcha layer crepe cake... Didn't like the texture of matcha cream...
author: Sunny S.

description: Grabbed a 6" strawberry vanilla cake as a small birthday treat for my son and was *highly* disappointed.  The 'cake' is basically two thin slivers of yellow cake, strawberries and 3, 4, 5 (?) cups of very heavy whipped cream.  Unbelievably, I paid $30 for a 6 inch cake that was 80% whipped cream.  I suppose the cake gets the 'healthier' label because it wasn't sweet, but it was probably one of the heaviest/richest cakes I've had in awhile.
author: jae p.

description: I love this place so much because their cakes are exceptional quality. It's so hard to find a cake that is fluffy yet spongey, sweet but not too sweet and is topped off with scrumptiously light yet buttery cream. Their service was great: efficient, friendly and professional. Even though I got there before my pick-up time and they were adding their last touches, they hustled just so I could get out of there with my order. If you enjoy eating foods with good quality, whole ingredients, and enjoy knowing who the chef is, order your cakes from here.
author: Sey P.

description: This is such a cute modest bakery. Sonya's cakes are just simply beautiful. I walked in and bought a slice of mango cake for my sister as a thank you for picking me up at work all the way from the south bay. When my sister tried it, she absolutely fell in love--with the cake of course. Many cakes like to stuff fruits but nothing comes close to tasting like mangoes and having some real delicious fruit! You can never go wrong with buying some cakes or pastries here.
author: Erin N.

description: I was very disappointed to have paid $5 for such a bland tiny piece of strawberry vanilla cake. the cake itself had a very poor texture...it was dense but not fluffy or sweet. I really wanted to like this place, but it is not up to par with other bakeries. If you want a good strawberry cake go to Gerhard Michler Fine European Desserts instead! (or café madeline - fresh fruit cake but ask for strawberries only).
author: Musetta S.

description: This place is a little overpriced but that darn olive oil banana bread that they serve in the mornings is just really yummy.  It's not too sweet, and has a delightful nuttiness and oat crunch to balance out its moist base.  Perfect with a piping hot cup of coffee.  The treats here feel and taste homemade and do not make you feel sick and guilty like those at Starbucks and other cafes.
author: Rupa P.

description:
I  ordered a Fruity Yogurt and a Triple Carrot & Apple cake for our monthly office birthday celebration.  Almost everyone enjoyed the cakes. 

Just be aware that you'll need to order two days ahead.
author: Jack Q.

description:
4.5 stars!

Absolutely delicious chocolate cake with strawberry filling.  It was as moist as other reviewers stated.  

Yes, it was quite expensive.  $30 for a 6" cake that was perhaps 2"-3" thick.  I can't blame the owner for the high price due to the cost of doing business in the City, e.g. the exorbitant rent, the Socialist Republic of San Francisco's regulations, ...

Service is extremely friendly.

Tried the vegan cookie.  Tasted way too healthy for my enjoyment.

I will need to try a few more cakes to have a proper rating of the body of works at Whole Cakes.  ;-)
author: Truc T.

description: My cousin purchased a blueberry cake from Whole Cakes for my grandma's birthday.  The texture of the cake was a little spongy (kind of reminds me of cakes from Chinese bakeries), but the blueberry flavor came through very well and the frosting wasn't too heavy or overbearing.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Very friendly atmosphere, and adds nice variety to street life in and around fidi. I want to like this place, I really do. 

5 stars for Chocolate Raspberry.
3 stars for strawberry vanilla.
1 star for price. 

Avg. 3 stars. 

Suggestions: 

1. Your packaging looks sublime. But 50 cents out of my $5 is likely going towards it. Try using something cheaper. 

2. Have a credit card min. to encourage people to use cash. 

3. Don't price in tax.

between 1, 2, and 3, you might be able to get your cost down to $4 or at the very least avoid the $5 sticker shock people have when they see a 1 inch slice for $5. 

.
author: S G.

description: I came to Whole Cakes with an impossible request - a garbage-truck-themed birthday cake for a three year old who loves berries - and oh, by the way, can you do it in three days? Sonya was amazing, helped come up with a design that made my boy say 'wow!' and our guests of all ages heading back for seconds! We had the double chocolate cake with strawberries and raspberries. Based on the number of people who asked where it was from (& the fact that the platter was practically scraped clean), it was a HUGE success. Thank you Sonya & family - you helped make this birthday very special!!
author: Meghan C.

description: Great place for a healthy dessert (oxymoron?)! The chocolate raspberry cake was decadent and light at the same time. Can't wait to try out more stuff from them.
author: Su C.

description:
We ordered a cake for our mother's birthday and it was a wonderful experience. You generally expect only the cake to be amazing, but from start to finish the entire process was amazing. The owner/chef is one of the sweetest people you will ever meet and truly cares about her customers. It was really simple to place the order and she personally delivered the cake to us. 

The whole family loved the cake, even though some family members don't always eat desserts. The cake made my mother's day special! 

They're opening a store in the Mission soon and I can't wait to visit.
author: Saad S.

description: I was surprised to see how small a $35 6-inch Sweet Potato cake is in person. The cake is simply decorated and so short. Each layer is about 1-1.5 cm high and the cake had 4 layers total -- 2 layers of cake and the top and middle layer of filling. The chunky sweet potato paste is starchy and slightly sweet. The chunks might be softened nuts or bits of sweet potato? One surface of the cake was dipped in almond flavoring. The taste is interesting and great for those who don't like sweets. I had planned to try the other unique cakes, but after seeing how this cake was constructed so sparingly, I don't plan to return anytime soon.
author: Ann H.

description:
I loved the cake i ordered from Whole Cakes.  So much so that two weeks later I have now placed my 2nd order for a cake from Whole Cakes.  The cake the first time was the basic vanilla cake with fresh strawberries and it was DELICIOUS!!!  I highly recommend it.  I'll try the second one soon and i ordered the triple choclate this time which Sonya told me is her best seller.  She even was able to write sweet birthday messages on top of the cakes.  

Definitely will be a repeat customer!

Thanks!
author: Lauren P.

description:
To the point.  Whole Cakes are light, fresh tasting, not-too-sweet, full of flavor (chocolate with raspberries in this case) and beautiful.  All organic. No dyes. Whipped cream frosting instead of that icky, greasy fake stuff on most bakery cakes.

The adult crowd at the graduation party where our cake was served absolutely raved.  

Add to the cake itself, the service and delivery were flawless and working with Sonya (the chef owner) and her staff was a delight.
Hence the 5 stars.  Whole Cakes makes pretty much the perfect cake.
author: M. G.

description: I ordered a cake from Whole Cakes for a graduation party.  The cake was wonderful and everyone agreed it was beautiful as well.  The next time I need a cake I know who to call! Highly recommended.
author: Graham T.

description:
Sonya has done it again! This is the second time I've bought a cake from Sonya and I can always count on her to create beautiful, delicious, and perfectly balanced cakes.  This time it was for my sister's future sister in law's birthday and the future in laws' entire family (grandma, aunts, uncles and more) were going to dinner with all of our family for the first time.  High stakes so I knew the only person I could count on to impress the future family was Sonya and she exceeded our expectations. We received so many compliments around the green tea chiffon cake being so light yet flavorful and moist...most people could not believe there was no butter! 


In addition, Sonya has amazing customer service. I am often changing logistics last minute and Sonya has always been very kind and accommodating to my strange schedule. The online order system is also fantastic and so easy to use. I can't wait for the store to open so we can buy more cakes!
author: Stacey W.

description:
Dang it.
I love their muffins.  LOVE I say!   I don't want to love their muffins, but I am weak when faced with their tastiness.   Light, fluffy, yummy, omg - so good.  

I work a couple of buildings over from their new (pretty & light) shop.  Some of the people I work with have brought their goodies in---   I've tried some of their cake slices - YUM! but, I can usually resist cake.   
Then their muffins were brought in... 
As I said - light, fluffy, tasty & totally addictive.   The first one I tried was a Dark Chocolate Walnut muffin.  What?? This has less sugar and less butter? How is it soooo good? Must be magic.  Tried their Yogurt Oat muffin.  It was good, but I like stuff in my muffin, so it didn't do wonders for me.  It was good - I just wanted more.    Today I stopped by to pick up our Friday muffins & they were so nice!  We had two new ones -- Dark Chocolate w/ Cacao Nibs  & Blueberry Oat...   Amazing!   

I don't know how she does it, but they are just so darn good!  They are all good - that I have tried so far - but you CANNOT go wrong if you try any of her chocolate muffins.  They are heavenly.
Just save one for me.   Maybe two. ;-)
author: Jen S.

description: I was disappointed to come in to the store at 2:00pm only to find 3 cakes to choose from.  I bought a slice of pistachio cake for $6.00.  It was rather dry.  It's pretty pricey for what you get and the taste was not fabulous.  I would rethink going back.
author: JD A.

description:
okay, so here's the thing- I wanted the best cake I could find for my fiancee's birthday. I work in Financial District and the reviews for Whole Cakes were very good. I called them and said that she is a chocolate lover and what would they recommend - they said the double chocolate raspberry. This had good reviews so I said sure, ordered it and paid for it. Showed up at agreed time the next day to pick it up and was told "Oh, we sold your cake - someone came in and needed one. Can you come back in an hour." WTF? I bought and paid for it, they made it, and someone came in and they took the "Happy Birthday Justine" lettering off (it was on pieces of white chocolate) and sold them my cake?  I could see the lettering in their display case.  I could not come back in an hour, I had meetings the rest of the day. They offered to deliver it by 4:30, so I said OK - what else am I going to do at that point?

It was delivered, I took it home and my fiancee did like it. The cake was actually pretty tasty, very much to my liking (not too sweet), but was not very chocolately - not sure where the double chocolate comes in. The cake I would probably give a solid 4.5, the shop was cute, the packaging very nice, the price what I expected. But selling a cake I had already bought and paid for to someone else? I was totally put off for the rest of the afternoon- did not need my stress level raised at that point.
author: Richard K.

description:
Sonya is the go-to baker for all special ocassions in our family. We love Whole Cakes' double chocolate and light chocolate cakes, and we're itching to try to the mocha cake. The cakes are light, airy, perfectly moist and satisfyingly sweet. The double chocolate cake was layered with fresh raspberries. So good! 

Their delivery service is excellent and remarkably affordable. Sonya is a wonderful lady, and it's very easy to work with her over email. I can't wait for their store to open!
author: Amisha M.

description: I ordered a Birthday cake for a friend of mine. As I live in Switzerland I searched on the web a bakery who deliver in SF. I am so glad to found whole cakes as the communication with Sonya was so friendly and fast. Apart from this the cake has been just fantastic and the delivery was by Sonya herself. All over an extraordinary service from her and whole cake ! Thank you so much ! So I can truly recommend whole cakes!
author: Andy W.

description: Great place in the FiDi to get coffee and dessert! A little bit on the pricy side but extremely delicious. The cakes are not too sweet and everything is made fresh. Loved the mocha cake!
author: McKenna T.

description:
Each birthday I spend considerable time answering questions about where the cake came from. I have a family tradition now of ordering from Whole Cakes. 

You can taste the difference between the sweet, light and satisfying Whole Cakes and the chemical variety. No tummy aches after cake because the ingredients are so 'clean'!

The price is very reasonable. The staff are very responsive, friendly and professional.
Delivery is a great option for not much more. 
Whole cakes is the best I've found and I've tried the rest!!!
author: Julie A.

description: Wonderful customer service. I brought the fruity yogurt cake to a dinner party and it was a smash hit. Light, fluffy, and not too sugary. Will definitely order from Whole Cakes again.
author: Kristen P.

description: Sonya was great in communicating with me-- she responded on a Saturday and I picked up on Tuesday.  I needed to buy a gluten free cake for my son's birthday (child in his class was allergic to gluten) and ordered the honey-almond cake.  I've never tried gluten free dessert, but it was better than I expected!  The cake was a perfect size for 10 little 2-3 year olds and not too sweet to give them a sugar high/low.  The bakery looked/smelled delicious, Sonya was really nice, I want to try more of their desserts!
author: Jane Y.

description: Sonya is amazing! I learned about her from my coworker who has been ordering cakes from Sonya for awhile. My coworker is pregnant and has gestational diabetes so when it came time to throw her baby shower, I went to Sonya. She put even less sugar in the cake than usual so my coworker could have some of it. Even with less sugar, the cake was amazing (the light chocolate)! Everyone loved it.
author: susie r.

description: Fresh, organic, and delicious cakes and pastries. Sonya puts care into everything she bakes. Got a black sesame cake for a friend's bday, was awesome!
author: Brandon W.

description: This is my new favorite place to get cakes! I ordered 2 cakes for the holidays (for both my immediate and extended family). I am particularly picky about the quality of the cake I eat, from the texture to the flavor, and Whole Cakes did not disappoint. I initially looked at all the other reviews, and seeing that the company got almost always perfect reviews, I decided to go for it even though I was hesitant of the cost. Do NOT get deterred from ordering from Whole Cakes because of this BECAUSE it is worth every penny from the cake to the service. The cakes themselves are delicious and OH SO BEAUTIFUL (like art basically). I think that Sonya, the owner, makes sure that they look beautiful and that her clients are happy. Every time I contacted her, she replied almost immediately and also quite friendly. I also love love LOVE her mission to make healthier cakes and I am all for it! She is super sweet with a great mission, so I say if you have doubts, just go for it because you will not be let down. She even sent me an email asking if I have suggestions to make it better (and thats when you know that she truly does take clients' feedback seriously). My dad who normally stays away from sweets ran to the fridge to grab cake because he too LOVED it! Even my grandma (75 and going) loved it and enjoyed that after eating the cakes, she didn't feel heavy or weighed down. My family is definitely going to order cakes from her for any and every occasion!
author: Sophie D.

description: Really delicious cakes. I've tried a several different flavors and they are all really so light and fluffy. The owner is extremely friendly as well and I stop by way too often.
author: Kristin L.

description: I found Whole Cakes on yelp and recently ordered the Coffee lover's mocha cake for my brother in law's birthday. The cake was just what we were looking for: light, simple and delicious. Just fantastic! The prices are reasonable and the chef (Sonya) is extremely responsive. She took it upon herself to ensure that the delivery was right, and that the cake was maintained at adequate temperature. Exceptional customer service and delivery system, and at a price you can't beat! I will definitely be a return customer.
author: Divya S.

description: I recently learned about Whole Cakes after tasting one of their cakes at a children's birthday party. It was delicious, light and fresh tasting. We enjoyed the cake so much that we decided to order from Whole Cakes for our kids' birthday this past week. The prices are very good and Sonya (chef and owner) was very responsive to our needs. For future occasions big or small, Whole Cakes will be my go to bakery!
author: Joanie L.
